headings: Coaching, Sport, Recreation and Fitness Administration M.Ed.
Prepare for highly-competitive career opportunities in a variety of fields.
Admission Requirements, Degree Plan and Courses
M.Ed. in Coaching, Sport, Recreation and Fitness (CSRF) Administration
What Can You Do With a CSRF Administration Degree?
Why Earn My CSRF Administration Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: In our hands-on, experiential-based program, you will develop your communication, leadership, research and critical-thinking skills while you specialize your degree plan to fit your career interests. You can choose from two degree specializations: Coaching/Sport Administration or Recreation/Fitness Administration.

Hands-on learning takes place in our state-of-the-art Ben Kelly Center for Human Performance and new Health and Human Services Building. You will also gain practical experience by attending professional conferences, clinics and symposiums, participating in community service, and creating written papers that are submitted and often published in industry journals.

Our faculty are also industry professionals who bring their real-world experience to the classroom and lab. You can collaborate with them on high-level research projects, and our small class sizes mean you get the individual attention you deserve, whether you attend on campus or online.
Tuition & FeesWe don’t sacrifice quality for affordability. Angelo State is committed to helping you achieve your educational goals with as little debt as possible.

ASU Distinguished Graduate ScholarshipsEarn our premier graduate scholarship based on your highest degree GPA. Once you are admitted to an ASU graduate program, you will automatically be considered. No application is necessary.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.

Start your career as soon as you graduate. Our program will prepare you for employment in a variety of fields, including coaching, athletic advising and administration, strength and conditioning for athletics, special event design, sports management, facilities management, all manner of recreation programs, and the fitness, resort and tourism industries.

We offerDeveloping Women Coaches Graduate Assistantshipsthat give our women students paid opportunities to work with one of ASU’s nine women’s athletic teams for up to two years. Additionalinstructional programming graduate assistantshipsare also available that give all students the opportunity to gain valuable coaching and instruction experience in Physical/Recreational Activity Classes and/or working with our various club sports and intercollegiate athletic teams.

Interested students can also earn anAthletic Academic Advising Certificate. This valuable credential will help you start or advance your career in student-athlete success programs, and you can complete the required courses within your degree plan. You get an additional credential without having to take extra classes, and the courses are available totally online.

You can join our program’s student organization for additional networking and professional development opportunities. Members also compete in intramurals, host social events, attend conferences and volunteer in the community. Our Simpson Leadership and Lifelong Learning Scholarships are available to offset registration costs.

Whether you’re pursuing a master’s degree, doctoral degree or certificate/certification, you have access to all the services in ourCollege of Graduate Studies and Research. You’ll find information and resources for everything from registering for classes and writing a thesis – to available graduate/teaching assistantships and graduate research opportunities.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

“All of my CSRF professors made an impact on me as a teacher/coach. I learned from their teaching styles just as much as I learned from the curriculum and content they taught me.”

Talon Smith, Classes of 2014 and 2016, History Teacher/Coach, Grapevine High School

“In CSRF: Sports Psychology, I loved to learn how I can make my athletes better by helping their mental game and not just the physical aspect of the game.”

Morgan Spearman, Classes of 2014 and 2016, Assistant Softball Coach, University of New Mexico

“Not only was Dr. Veronica Snow a great professor that pushed our classes to better themselves academically, she was a mentor of mine that got me to where I am today.”

James Dougherty, Class of 2012, M.Ed. in Coaching, Sport, Recreation and Fitness Administration

“Everything I learned in the CSRF program was practical information that applied directly to my line of work. Having this master’s degree makes me stand out when I am applying for a job.”

Talon Smith, Classes of 2014 and 2016, M.Ed. in Coaching, Sport, Recreation and Fitness Administration
